I'm not sure, but if you can post the offending test, we'll better be
able to help.

So said  Kevin Klinemeier  on  1/7/2003 --------------------

>Can anyone shed light on this problem?  When my tests receive
>exceptions which are thrown (all my cases throw Exception), the error
>state is reported by JUnit, but the stack trace (and the exception
>name!) is not in the output.  
>
>Here's a sample output:
>
>..E.
>
>Time: 6.84
>
>There was 1 error:
>
>1) testWarningMessages(com.expd.app.directship.speed.SpeedParser_UT)
>
>FAILURES!!!
>
>Tests run: 4,  Failures: 0,  Errors: 1
>
>
>My tests are pretty vanilla stuff, I haven't extended or changed any
>parts of the framework.  For now, I've been wrapping my tests that
fail
>in try/catch blocks so I can do my work, but clearly this isn't
>something I should have to do (or have needed to do in the past).
>
>Anyone else seen this?  
>
>Kevin
